Ltd's (SKT  A-/Stable)  failure to  acquire South Korea's largest cable television operator will leave it a distant  second behind KT Corporation (A-/Stable) in the fixed-line telecommunications  market. content: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) SEOUL  November 04 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings says SK Telecom Co.  Ltd's (SKT;  A-/Stable) proposed acquisition of a stake in CJ HelloVision Co.  Ltd (CJH)  the  largest cable television operator in South Korea  will have no immediate rating  effect on SKT or  SK Broadband Co.  Ltd. (SKB  A-/Stable). The acquisition is  likely to boost SKT's media business by broadening its subscriber base and  strengthening its bundled services sales. SKT w
name: SK Telecom Co Ltd
title: Fitch: No Immediate Rating Impact on SK Telecom from CJ Hellovision Purchase

content: SEOUL  Sept 24 South Korean mobile carrier SK Telecom Co Ltd said on Thursday that it will buy back 523 billion won ($438.21 million) worth of its own shares in order to boost shareholder value.
name: SK Telecom Co Ltd
title: SK Telecom says to buy back $438 mln worth of own shares

content: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) SEOUL/HONG KONG  March 24 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings says SK Telecom Co.  Ltd.'s  (SKT; A-/Stable) proposed acquisition of minorities' shares in SK Broadband Co.   Ltd. (SKB; BBB+/Stable) will not affect SKT's rating. The acquisition may  strengthen the ties between SKT and SKB  but we see no immediate rating impact  on SKB.  Fitch believes SKT's credit profile will remain in line with its current rating  level as the company will exchange i
name: SK Telecom Co Ltd
title: Fitch: No Immediate Rating Impact from SKT's Full Acquisition of SKB

content: SEOUL South Korean telecommunications firm SK Telecom Inc  said on Friday it seeks to acquire the remaining 49.4 percent stake in internet services provider SK Broadband  via a share swap offer valued at 706 billion won ($627.17 million).
name: SK Telecom Co Ltd
title: SK Telecom offers to acquire rest 49.4 percent stake in SK Broadband

content: SEOUL  March 20 South Korean telecommunications firm SK Telecom Inc said on Friday it seeks to acquire the remaining 49.4 percent stake in internet services provider SK Broadband via a share swap offer valued at 706 billion won ($627.17 million).
name: SK Telecom Co Ltd
title: SK Telecom offers to acquire rest 49.4 pct stake in SK Broadband
